summary: This document is a set of 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Special Housing Unit for July 4, 2019. It details the required observation schedule for inmates in locked-down status and includes signature blocks for supervising lieutenants and a captain, but no specific inmate or staff names are listed.

events.title: Daily inmate observation checks
events.description: Routine 30-minute observation checks of inmates in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York were conducted throughout the day, as documented on multiple check sheets.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a prison log sheet from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit dated July 4, 2019.
It outlines the protocol for observing inmates in locked-down status (e.g., administrative detention or disciplinary segregation) at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The log includes multiple signature blocks for 'LIEUTENANT' and 'CAPTAIN' from Morning Watch, Day Watch, and Evening Watch operations, but no individual names are provided.
The document is part of a series, as indicated by file numbers EFTA00121453 through EFTA00121458.
No specific inmates, including Jeffrey Epstein, are named in the provided text excerpts.
